conclusion: Determine the time it takes for a charged particle to complete a semicircular path in each magnetic field and return to point O.
In a magnetic field, a charged particle moving perpendicularly to the field follows a circular path.
The radius of the path is given by r = mv/qB.
Calculate the radius in B1: r1 = mv/qB1.
Calculate the radius in B2: r2 = mv/qB2.
The period T of the circular motion in a magnetic field is T = 2πm/qB.
Calculate the period in B1: T1 = 2πm/qB1.
Calculate the period in B2: T2 = 2πm/qB2 = 2T1.
The time for a semicircular path in B1 is t1 = T1/2 = πm/qB1.
The time for a semicircular path in B2 is t2 = T2/2 = 2πm/qB1.
Total time to return to point O is t = t1 + t2 = 3πm/qB1.
The particle will pass through point O downward again after a time of 3πm/qB1.
